did.unittitle: Tēlemachos Alaveras Papers and Nea Poreia Archives
did.abstract: Consists of personal papers of Tēlemachos Alaveras, a prolific Modern Greek writer and editor of the literary magazine Nea Poreia for more than fifty years. He was also the president of the Literary Society of Thessalonikē and member of boards of many other organizations. Included also are the archives of Nea Poreia, as well as the personal papers of Alaveras's father, Chrēstos Alaveras.
did.physloc: This collection is stored partially onsite (Boxes 14, 40, 46-47, 82, 85) at Firestone Library and partially offsite (rest of the boxes) at the ReCAP facility.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: For preservation reasons, original analog and digital media may not be read or played back in the reading room. Users may visually inspect physical media but may not remove it from its enclosure. All analog audiovisual media must be digitized to preservation-quality standards prior to use. Audiovisual digitization requests are processed by an approved third-party vendor. Please note, the transfer time required can be as little as several weeks to as long as several months and there may be financial costs associated with the process. Requests should be directed through the Ask Us Form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection comprises ninety-seven boxes of autograph manuscripts and typescripts, correspondence, printed material, audio-visual material, and photographs pertaining to Tēlemachos Alaveras as a Greek writer and as an editor of the literary magazine Nea Poreia. The papers include personal correspondence with major Greek writers and poets, such as Rita Boumē Papa, Dinos Christianopoulos, Margarita Dalmatē, Nikos Dēmou, Giōrgos Iōannou, Timos Malanos, Michalēs Meraklēs, Takēs Papatsōnēs, Pantelēs Prevelakēs, Apostolos Sachinēs, Helenē Vakalo, Giōrgos Veēs, and Chrysanthē Zitsaia. Included also are Alaveras's first writings, notebooks, talks, book reviews, interviews, and awards; writings by other people; the archives of the magazine Nea Poreia; material of other Greek associations or organizations where Alaveras was a board member or president; and finally, personal papers of Chrēstos Alaveras, Tēlemachos Alaveras's father.

Princeton University Library's Special Collections does not charge any permission or use fees for the publication of images of materials from our collections, nor does it require researchers to obtain its permission for said use. The department does request that its collections be properly cited and images credited. More detailed information can be found on the Copyright, Credit and Citations Guidelines page on our website. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us through the Ask Us! form.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tēlemachos Alaveras was born on September 30, 1926 in Plovdiv, Eastern Rumelia (now Bulgaria). The following year his family moved to Thessalonikē, a city they were destined never to leave. The writer appears in the literature with stories in magazines, and soon he asserts himself and becomes famous all over Greece. In 1952 he issued his first book, a series of stories drawn from the civil war in Greece, with the title Ta agrimia tou allou dasous. But the writer first appeared with the novel To horologi, second edition 1990, in the Greek literature. After that Alaveras published the books To miso tou phengariou (stories, 1960), second edition 1990; To sēmerino syngraphiko provlēma (essay, 1961); Hodostrōtēras, (novel, 1963), second edition 1973, third edition 1988. After a great break, Alaveras publishes the study Diēgēmatographoi tēs Thessalonikēs in 1970, and in 1971 the forerunning play in one act Hoi alloi. Apart from these his main study "Ta logotechnika periodika tēs Thessalonikēs (1880-1955)" ["The literary magazines of Thessalonikē (1880-1995)"] was published in stories to be continued in the early press. In 1976 Alaveras issued seven stories with the title Ap'aphormē (second edition 1978). In 1977 this book received the First State Prize for story-writings. In 1985 he issued the volume of stories with the title Gōnies kai opseis, second edition 1988, which received the Ouranē Prize by the Academy of Athens. In 1987 he published the prose "Archeion" Averkiou Sverkiadē," and in 1990 the book Se eutheia grammē. Taxidi stēn Polōnia. In 1991 this book received the National Chronicle-Witness Award. In 1990 he issued one volume with critical notes in books with the title Sēmeiōseis.

Alaveras was the editor of the literary magazine Nea Poreia from the day the magazine was issued (1955). He was also the president of the Literary Society of Thessalonikē. He was a member of boards of state organizations and literary competitions, theater, and film-competitions.

His works have been translated into German, Dutch, Italian, Bulgarian, Swedish, Serbian, and Polish. Tēlemachos Alaveras belongs to the post-war novelists of Thessalonikē and is one of the first writers who exploited the theme of the Greek Civil War period. Married to poet Roula Alavera and had two sons. He died on June 30, 2007.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of Tēlemachos Alaveras's autograph and typed manuscript drafts of his writings; correspondence with his friends, colleagues, and acquaintants; documents; writings by others; personal photographs or in connection with Nea Poreia ; audio-visual material; and clippings of newspapers and literary magazines.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series has been organized into ten subseries: A. Correspondence; B. Works by Alaveras; C. Talks, Questionnaires, TV Series, and Interviews; D. Conferences and Meetings; European Programs; E. Literary Competitions and Awards; F. Documents; G. Writings by Others; H. Photographs; I. Audio-Visual Material; Designs; and K. Printed Material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of incoming and outgoing correspondence with Tēlemachos Alaveras's close friends, colleagues, acquaintances, institutions, organizations, and foundations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries has been organized into books, diaries, and miscellaneous writings: the books have been arranged in an alphabetical order by the title of the work; the diaries and the miscellaneous writings have been arranged in a chronological order, starting with the earliest dates.

scopecontent.p: Includes autograph and typescript drafts, page proofs (first, second, and final editions), and printed material regarding the publication of the book.

There are also congratulation letters from several recipients of the book, including: Pantelēs Prevelakēs; Mēnas Dēmakēs; Phoula Lambelet; Zēsimos Lorentzatos; E.P. scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes autograph manuscript drafts by Alaveras. Newspaper clippings from various local papers from 1965-1982 have been transfered in Box 43 (folder 1).

In this folder is kept material that Alaveras put together with the drafts of Sēmeiōseis, such as page proofs and clippings of articles or essays published in several Greek literary magazines. Included are: "Skepseis ap'aphormē tis prozes tou Themelē hopou synantietai hyliko tēs poiēsēs tou" published in Ho poiētēs Giōrgos Themelēs: tomos timētikos, 1971; "Prōtes synantēseis" published in Nea Hestia, 1698-1699 (1-15 April 1998); "Thelō mia eikona" dated July 1, 1993; "Me tous planētas" published in Nea Hestia, 1403 (1985); "Amerimnoamerimnos" published in Kritikē parousia tou Petrou S. Spandōnidē, (1992); "Entechnos logos" publisehd in hē lexē, 144 (March-April 1998); "Diavazontas ton Ḏostogiephski tou Tasou Athanasiadē"; "D.K. Vogazlēs: henas machētēs tou Valkanikou hellēnismou" published in Nea Hestia, 1571 (Christmas 1992); "Arthra kai meletēmata gia tē zōē kai to ergo tou Paulou Papasiōpē" in Elimeiaka, 3; Tou Giōtamē in Aphierōma ston I.M. Panagiōtopoulo, 1988; and "Logotechnika themata" in Nearchos, 29 (October-December 2003); "Katochiko" (23.2.1989).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Alaveras's autograph manuscripts of his novel To rologi. There is also incoming and outgoing correspondence with Alaveras's friends and colleagues, including: Sphakianakēs, Giannēs; Dēmakes, Mēnas; Thrylos, Alkēs; Sinopoulos, Takēs; Varvitsiōtēs, Takēs; Kotsiras, Giōrgēs; Athanasoulēs, Kritōn; Tsoukalas, Geōrgios, and the French Institute at Athens (Greece).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Alaveras's autograph manuscripts; Petros Spandōnidēs's review "Apopseis ap'aphormē to dokimio To sēmerino syngraphiko provlēma"; photocopies of printed reviews by Spandōnides; clippings; and incoming correspondence from Meraklēs, Michalēs; Panagiōtopoulos, I.M.; Kotzias, Alexandros; Athanasoulēs, Kritōn; and Glezos, Petros.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of loose pages of autograph manuscripts of Alaveras's daily personal experiences, thoughts or feelings, including comments on current events. He also kept clippings of newspapers and other printed material that they were of his interest. The material is kept in the way Alaveras had organized it. A handwritten note on one of the discarded envelopes stated that all this material is unpublished.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes autograph manuscript drafts of Alaveras's essays, short stories, and poems in Greek. Some of them were kept in a folder entitled "Kampanes. Pezographēmata." Included are: "Hoi Megalexantroi" dated 1947 and published in the magazine Morphes, 9 (January 1947); "Polemikē pezographia" dated 1952; "Ho dromos mas. Se eikones pente pente skēnes" dated 1945; "Narkalieutēs"; "Phantastikes phōnes" dated 1949; "Henas logos me logikē kai chōris logikē" dated 1949; "T'agrimia tou allou dasous" dated 1950; "Hē pneumatikē Thessalonikē tou 1952"; a notebook with a novel entitled " Sta skotadia tēs Tsouka-Rōssa" dated 1952; "Pera apo to sēmeio stērigmatos" dated 1952. Other stories included are: "Moirolatrēs"; "To dentraki" dated 1944; "Ho mastro-Nikolas"; "Hagnē, Hagnoula"; "Gia to Mesolongi"; "To tēlephōno" dated 1944; "Hē emporissa"; and many others. There is also a small notebook dated 1962 and one folder consisting of undated early writings. Additionally, there are issues of the student magazine Pnoē/ 2-3, 6-7, where Alaveras published some of his earliest writings dated 1944-1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes autograph manuscript drafts of Alaveras's short stories: "Arta Kor"; "Napoleōn"; "Grammata Verenikēs"; "Eukaireies"; "Gephyrōsē tou chronikou chasmatos," and "Amixia";"K' hoi treis"; "Aeropetamata" or "Eis ton kairon" an excerpt of the unpublished Pessoi.

did.unittitle: Ta logotecnhika periodika tēs Thessalonikes (1889-1954). Symvolē stēn historia kai to periochomeno tous.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a study that Alaveras's prepared on the literary magazines of Thessalonikē from 1889 to 1955. Included are autograph and typescript drafts; a copy of the by-laws of the magazine Morphes dated 1952) and two essays entitled: "Typographeia kai ephēmerides tēs Thessalonikēs" and "Ta logotechnika periodika kai vivlia tēs Thessalonikēs" by Vasileios G. Aidalēs, both dated 1974. Roula Alavera's note on the discarded envelope stated that this was a personal study by Alaveras.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes autograph manuscript notes and thoughts by Alaveras. Roula Alaveras's note on the discarded evelope stated: "There are notes that were used for Alaveras's novels or intended for future publication."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of autograph manuscripts and typescripts, as well as printed material regarding literary competitions and awards that Alaveras received for his published works.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries has been organized in a chronogical order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Alaveras's notes; printed material regarding the literary competitions Dēmētria and Vellidē; abstracts and comments of the theatrical plays that were submitted for the competitions; the competition postings; a book of Minutes of the jury for a literary contest for the newspaper Thessalonikē dated 1966; and the Minutes of the International Film Festival of Thessalonikē dated 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes the National Literary Award for Alaveras's book Ap'aphormē and congratulation letters. Correspondents included are: Papaditsas, D. P.; Papadakē, Eleutheria I.; Vaphopoulos, G. Th.; Varverēs, Giannēs; Stamelos, Dēmētrēs; Papathemelēs, Stelios; Papadēmas, Adamantios; Kalphopoulos, Chrēstos; Paraskeuopoulou, Kitsa; Tatsēs, Michalēs; Spetzopoulos, Petros; Zitsaia, Chrysanthē; Stergiopoulos, Kōstas; Sarantē, Galateia; Dalmatē, Margarita; Iōannidēs, I.D.; Sphakianakēs, Giannēs; Kokkinos, Dēmosthenēs; Kontou, Nana; Thoividopoulos, Dēmētrēs; Papadakē, Eleutheria; and Agathopoulou, Maria. There are also clippings of Greek newspapers and one issue of the magazine Physiolatrikos kosmos (January-March 1978) regarding the award.

did.unittitle: National Chronicle-Witness Award (see also Box 42, folder 10 for clippings)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes autograph notes by Alaveras; a telegram; and the printed program of the National Literary Awards. Alaveras received the Chronicle-Witness Award for his work S'eutheia grammē.

did.unittitle: National Awards for Writing Theatre Projects

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of autograph manuscripts and typescripts of short stories, poems, essays, translations, and book reviews. Included are writings by Thales Rētoridēs: "Triantaphyllenia zōē"; Mēnas Dēmakes; Giōrgos Delios: "Skies"; several poems by Zōe Karellē; Arēs Diktaios; Dēmētrēs A. Dēmētriadēs; Tasos Korphēs; Vasileios Laourdas; Jean Paul Mestas; Bampēs Nintas; Anthou Pōgōnitē; Giannēs Varverēs; Manos Eleutheriou; O. Sans; Tasia Adam; Nikos Papanas; Stauros Vavourēs; Takēs Varvitsiōtēs (the poem "Exoristos"); Andreas Angelakēs; a manuscript by an unknown author entitled "Delphikes giortes" with a handwritten copy of Angelos Sikelianos's letter dated March 12, 1925; and a book review by Panos K. Thasitēs (he signs as Vasiles Nēsiōtēs).

There is also an incomplete essay by Vasilēs Phrankos entitled: "Kritikē henos kritikou"; the poem "Symphōnia tou Septemvriou" by Milosz, O. V. de L. in Greek translation by Tasos Korphēs; the poem "Gynaika tēs Genova" by Dino Campana in Greek translation by Nikos Spanias; two translations by Takēs Varvitsiōtēs: "Ōdē sto Phenteriko Gkarthia Lorka" and "Ho cheimōnas mas"; book reviews written by G. Kyriakou; an interview of Cristino Sangiglio. Included are talks by Tadeusz Szymanski and Heinz Kunio that were given at the Jewish Community of Thessalonikē (1988).

Included also are: poetry contest of college students; a college paper on Chalastra of Thessalonikē; two papers of high school students; typescripts of poems of Greek college students that participated in a poetry contest. A typescript of a talk by Kounio, Chaints Salvatōr, "Apo ton Antisēmitismo tou Tritou Raich stē Nychta tōn Krystallōn kai ten telikē lysē tou Hevraikou provlēmatos."

scopecontent.p: Consists of autograph manuscripts of reviews of Alaveras's books: Ho hodostrotēras by S.I. Vasileiadēs, T'agrimia tou allou dasous, and To rologi by Bampēs Nintas, K.G. Kosmas, and Giōrgos Delios; typescripts of a radio program by Giannēs Karalēs broadcast on the Nation Broadcasting Corporation-Radio of Patras in 1952. Included also are photocopies of essays or reviews of Alaveras's books published in Greek literary magazines by several Greek writers; a talk with the title "To periodiko Nea Poreia kai ho Tēlemachos Alaveras" given on December 11, 2010 at the Hetairia Logotechnōn Thessalonikēs [The Literary Society of Thessalonikē] by an unidentified speaker. There is also a second talk probably given during the same event (undated); and a college research paper.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes autograph manuscripts and photocopies of typescripts with handwritten corrections of Alaveras's work T'agrimia tou allou dasous [Les bêtes sauvages de l'autre forêt] translated into French by Annie Koutokoi-Chatzipoulidou; typescripts of a German translation; photocopies of printed translations into German of the works "Paraisthēseis" and "Mia mera akomē"; "La meta della luna" in Italian published in L'Argime Letterario, Nuova Serie (Dicembre 1971); "Un giorno ancora" published in Alla Bottega, Anno X, no. 2 (Marzo-Aprile 1972); "Pro-po" ["Fussballtoto"] in German translation by W. Ekschmitt; "Wahnvorstellungen" translated by Judith Eickler; and translations in Cyrillic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes notes, typescripts and autograph manuscripts by Alaveras; lists of his bibliography and published bookreviews of his works; a press release; and two CDs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes photographs of Tēlemachos and Roula Alaveras; portraits of Alaveras; Alaveras with his friends, colleagues, politicians, relatives, and acquaintances participating in several events: award ceremonies; meetings with old classmates; taks; literary symposia; book signings; book presentations; exhibitions; events organized by Roula Alavera; the opening ceremony of the Vaphopouleion Cultural Center; and others. There are also portraits of several Greek writers or poets, such as Giannēs Ritsos (included a copy of a photograph of Ritsos with Manos Katrakes in the exile); Dēmētrēs Dēmou; Kōstas Varnalēs; Giōrgēs Kotsiras; Paulos Papasiōpēs; Helenē Vakalo; Alkiviadēs Giannopoulos; Chrēstos Dalias; Anastasēs Vistōnitēs; Michales Meraklēs; Mēnas Dēmakēs; Paulos Spandōnidēs; Giannēs Sphakianakēs; Giōrgos Themelēs; and many others, as well as politicians.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries has been arranged in a chronological order except the first folder.

did.unittitle: Portraits of Tēlemachos and Roula Alaveras

National Chronicle-Witness Award Ceremony; High School Students Event
Opening Ceremony of Vaphopouleio Pneumatiko Kentro

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs of Nea Poreia event at Vaphopouleio Pneumatiko Kentro (Vaphopouleion Cultural Center); the International Conference Kōstē Palama; a meeting with Alaveras's classmates; and a student event with the Hetaireia Logotechnōn Thessalonikēs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs of the lecture with Kaphtantzēs; a literary event for Takes Varvitsiōtēs; and an award ceremony.

Logotechniko Vraveio Phreiderikou Mathious; Hetairia Logotechnōn Thessalonikēs [Thessalonikē Writer's Association]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of audio-visual material containing information about Alaveras's books, Nea Poreia publications, cultural events, radio programs, and some book designs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subsereis has been organized by type of material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of clippings of newspapers and literary magazines regarding literary activities in Thessalonikē, Greece.

arrangement.head: Arrangement

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings of several Greek, American, and French newspapers, which contain articles on literary topics written by Tēlemachos Alaveras and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of reviews about Alavera's works and awards. There are also articles or stories published in series. This group has been organized in an alphabetical order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings regarding book reviews and the award that Alaveras received.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes offprints and issues of literary magazines. Included are: the article "Ta prōta logotechnika periodika tēs Thessalonikēs (1921-1924)" by Dinos Christianopoulos published in Diagōnios, 1975; the essay "Hellēnikos logotechnikos periodikos typos (1974-1984)" by Antōnēs Kalphas dated 1985; Diavazō, 747 (1986); Aristotelēs 10 (May 15, 1889); Logotechniko deltio, 37 (August 1970); Exōstēs, 76 (December 22, 1989); Pyrsos tōn apophoitōn tou Peiramatikou, 3 (December 1953); Neanikē skepsē, 1 (December 1, 1929); Augē, 3 (1922); and clippings of Greek newspapers with reviews of Alaveras's book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings of local newspapers and literary magazines; Dōdekatē hōra, 8; Pneumatikē Kypros, 46-47 (July-August 1964); and Euvoikos logos, 71-73 (January-March 1964).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes originals and photocopies, as well as clippings of several literary magazines, which according to Roula Alavera's note on the discarded envelope they were used as references for Tēlemachos Alaveras's study on the literary journals of Thessalonikē (see: "Ta logotechnika periodika tēs Thessalonikēs"). Included are: Aristotelēs, 1 (January 1889); Phōnē tēs proodou, 90 (October 1979); Makedonikē zōē, 172 (September 1980); Vivliothēkē, 118 (September 1, 2000) and 240 (January 24, 2003); 6ē Hēmera, 49 (February 12-13, 2000); Mēnes, (January-February and March-April 1962); Ta phoitētika grammata, 1 (March 1955); 2 (April 1955); and 3 (May-June 1953); Eumenēs, March and April 1959; and Kouinta, 6 (May 1996).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of autograph manuscripts and typescripts of published and unpublished works by several Greek writers or poets, including Tēlemachos Alaveras.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series has been organized into five subseries: A. Nea Poreia Journal; B. Nea Poreia Publications; C. Associations-Organizations; D. Miscellaneous Documents: Legal; Financial; Contact Information; Press; Memorabilia; and E. Printed Material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes originals and copies of autograph manuscripts and typescripts, as well as page proofs with autograph manuscript annotations of works by several modern Greek poets and writers published in the issues of the literary magazine Nea Poreia. There are also a few photographs (color and black-and-white); floppy disks; and clippings of Greek newspapers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes printed invitations, brochures, the program of the exhibition, the publications of Nea Poreia (1955-1992), and the roundtable discussion (January 29, 1992) that took place at the Vaphopouleion Cultural Center. There is an autograph manuscript of Michalēs Meraklēs's presentation and Alaveras's miscellaneous notes. Included also are plans of the exhibition gallery; posters; the captions of the items; and color photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series has been organized in three subseries: A. Correspondence; B. Documents; and C. Photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of incoming and outgoing correspondence among close relatives or friends of Chrēstos Alaveras.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries has been organized in an alphabetical order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes outgoing correspondence to Tēlemachos Alaveras.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondecne between Aikaterinē (Katina) and Chrēstos Alaveras (parents of Tēlemachos Alaveras).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes incoming and outgoing corrsepondence with Chrēstos Alaveras's siblings, the Archimandritēs Phōtios of Philippopolis (Bulgaria), and acquaintances.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes incoming and outgoing correspondence among close family members and friends, with his brother Chrēstos Alaveras, his sister Pēnelopē, with Charalampos Varympopēs, and one letter to an unidentified recipient.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes incoming and outgoing correspondence between Pēnelope Giarikē and her brother Chrēstos Alaveras. There are also two letters from Pēnelopē to Katina (Aikaterinē) Alavera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes incoming and outgoing correspondence mostly with Chrēstos and Katina (Aikaterinē) Alaveras and with Tēlemachos and Dēmētrios Alaveras. There is also a letter from Charikleia to her son, Andreas; one letter from Geōrgios Kakridēs to Katina Alavera; one letter from Pēnelope Giarikē; two letters from Charikleia to her nephew, Tēlemachos Alaveras; and one letter from Tēlemachos to his uncle Geōrgios.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes incoming and outgoing correspondence with Chrēstos and Vasilikē Alaveras (Mezevirēs's sister).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a bound volume containing carbon copies of Geōrgios Tsoukalas's letters to relatives and acquaintances both in Greek and French dated 1927-1929, as well as original outgoing correspondence from both Geōrgios and Koula Tsoukalas (1927-1979).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence from Agēsilaos Alaveras to his father (one letter); from Charikleia Kakridē to Maria (unidentified); from aunt Helenē (unidentified) to Katina (Aikaterinē) Alaveras; from Geōrgios N. Chatzidakis; from Kōnstantinos Boukouras; from Marika Pappa; from Georges I. Kyrou. There is also one folder of correspondence mostly in Bulgarian and French. Additionally, there are many empty envelopes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of personal documents of Chrēstos Alaveras's family.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries has been organized by type of material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes loose pages of notebooks, one bound, and one teared containing detailed personal accounts of Chrēstos Alaveras in Bulgaria.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes three notebooks of Chrēstos Alaveras containing daily accounts of his family expenses in Greek and a few receipts in Bulgarian, as well as other information pertinent to his business mostly with family members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes miscellaneous financial and other legal documents of Chrēstos Alaveras mostly in Bulgarian and some in Greek; there is also correspondence with his brother Geōrgios regarding their father's property; one letter from his sister, Pēnelopē; and a few letters from acquaintances pertinent to business in Greek. (Tēlemachos Alaveras's note on the discarded envelope stated that these documents are from Bulgaria).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes notebooks of daily expenses. Note by Tēlemachos Alaveras on the discarded envelope stated that this material contains information about a case in Bulgaria.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes several documents in Bulgarian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes documents of Chrēstos Alaveras in Bulgarian. Handwritten note by Tēlemachos Alaveras explains that the content of this folder was submitted to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs by Chrēstos on October 8, 1948. Included is the receipt of the application and a handwritten note by Chrēstos Alaveras.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes several documents regarding family assets and marriage contracts of Alaveras's family. The documents are written mostly in Bulgarian and Greek and a few in French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes apartment lease agreements by Chrēstos Alaveras and handwritten receipts in Greek.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a notebook, loose pages, and correspondence with the advocat, George Kyrou, regarding claiming issues.

did.unittitle: Committee for Emigration of Minorities between Greece and Bulgaria
Certificat de membre de minorite ethnique; Declaration d'Emigration; Lettre de voiture

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes the original documents of the divorce petition that Katina (Aikaterinē Tsoukala) Alavera filed for the dissolution of her marriage with Chrēstos Alaveras. There are also handwritten original copies of the birth certificate and baptism of Tēlemachos Alaveras; receipts of tuition payment for the elementary school for Tēlemachos and handwritten notes on the expenses. There is also the individual health booklet of Chrēstos.

did.unittitle: Birth certificate; school transcript; and applications

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are miscellaneous financial and other legal documents, notebooks, and notes written mostly in Bulgarian, in Greek, and some in French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a notebook of Alaveras's mother written in French and loose pages both in Greek and in French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a notebook written by Aikaterinē Tsoukala containing autograph manuscript drafts regarding her genealogical tree. It is entitled: "Katerinē Tsoukala. To oikogeneiako mas dendro. 1977."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes miscellaneous legal and medical documents, her identification card, and notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of Chrēstos Alavera family photographs.

arrangement.p: This subseries has been organized approximately in a chronological order.
